page.name: Have learners watch 30 seconds of a video on silent and make up the dialogue
page.content:
Interpreting a photo or video uses literacy skills, too.

Consider checking out the TV show: "Who’s Line is it Anyway?" It’s a comedy that often has a section where comics watch an old film on silent and make up the dialogue for the characters.

Consider finding some clips of films appropriate for your classroom and having learners break into groups to write narratives for each character they are assigned. They can then share their writings with each other by talking with a partner and then sharing out with the whole class.

Go back to the Try It Yourself Section for a list of all Try it Yourself Options.
